```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(RSQLite)
library(scales)
```

## A Data Source: New York Times
* Github: https://github.com/nytimes/

```{r,echo=FALSE}
rm(list=ls())
db <- dbConnect(SQLite(), dbname="../COVIDDB/COVID.sqlite3")
STATES <- dbGetQuery(db, "SELECT * FROM us_states ;")
STATES$date <- as.Date(STATES$date)
ST <- STATES %>% filter(date =="2020-07-23")
```

## Total Cases and Deaths by Statev(as of July 27, 2020)

```{r, echo=FALSE}
ST %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x=cases,y=reorder(state,cases))) +
  labs(title="Total Cases by State as of July 27,2020")   +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
ST %>% ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x=deaths,y=reorder(state,deaths))) +
  labs(title="Total Deaths by State as of July 27, 2020") 
```

## States with 25,000 or Fewer Cases (as of July 27, 2020)

```{r,echo=FALSE}
ST %>% filter(cases <=25000) %>%
  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x=cases,y=state)) +
  labs(title="States with 25, 000  Or Fewer Cases as of July 27, 2020") +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```

### States with 49999 or fewer Cases (as of Jul 27, 2020 )

```{r,echo=FALSE}
ST %>% filter(cases <=49999) %>%
  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x=cases,y=state)) +
  labs(title="States with 49999  Or Fewer Cases as of July 27, 2020") +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = scales::comma)
```
```{r,echo=FALSE}
ST %>% filter(cases >=50000) %>%
  ggplot() + geom_col(aes(x=cases,y=state)) +
  labs(title="States with 50,000 or more Cases as of July 27, 2020") +

```
